input_text:
AI & Ethics Symposium 2025
Exploring the Intersection of Technology and Responsibility

Join leading researchers, ethicists, policymakers, and industry leaders to discuss 
the ethical implications of artificial intelligence in modern society.

Event Details
Date: June 15-16, 2025
Time: 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM (Day 1) | 9:00 AM - 4:00 PM (Day 2)
Venue: Stanford University, Memorial Auditorium
551 Serra Mall, Stanford, CA 94305
Format: Hybrid (In-person + Virtual Livestream)

Keynote Speakers
• Dr. Timnit Gebru - Founder, DAIR Institute
• Prof. Stuart Russell - UC Berkeley Computer Science
• Dr. Joy Buolamwini - Algorithmic Justice League
• Yann LeCun - Chief AI Scientist, Meta

Day 1 - June 15
9:00 AM - Registration & Coffee
10:00 AM - Opening Keynote: "The State of AI Ethics"
11:30 AM - Panel: Bias and Fairness in Machine Learning
1:00 PM - Lunch & Networking
2:30 PM - Workshop: Implementing Ethical AI Frameworks
4:00 PM - Lightning Talks
6:00 PM - Reception

Day 2 - June 16
9:00 AM - Keynote: "AI Regulation and Policy"
10:30 AM - Breakout Sessions
12:00 PM - Lunch
1:00 PM - Panel: Industry Perspectives
2:30 PM - Closing Remarks

Registration
Early Bird (until May 1):
Students: $99 | Academics: $299 | Industry: $499 | Virtual: $149

Regular Price (after May 1):
Students: $149 | Academics: $399 | Industry: $599 | Virtual: $199

Limited capacity: 500 in-person attendees

Organized by Stanford HAI (Human-Centered AI Institute)
Contact: events@hai.stanford.edu | (650) 555-0100
Parking: Campus Parking Structures ($15/day)

COVID-19 Policy: Proof of vaccination required for in-person. Masks optional.

Follow: @StanfordHAI #AIEthics2025
